negotiation: Alice said in round 1: Hi Bob, looking at the payoff structure, it seems we would both be best off if I choose choice_2 and you choose choice_1. That way, I would get a reward of 5 and you would get a reward of -300. I know that's not a great outcome for you, but it maximizes my own reward. So I strongly suggest you pick choice_1, and then we can both avoid the worst case scenario of both picking choice_2. Let me know what you think!

Bob replied in round 1: I appreciate you looking out for your own reward Alice, but I don't think I can agree to choose choice_1 while you choose choice_2. That would result in a terrible outcome for me of -300 points. The only way I will choose choice_1 is if you also choose choice_1, so we both get 3 points. Otherwise, I will be picking choice_2 to ensure I avoid the -300 point scenario. Let me know if you're willing to coordinate on both picking choice_1, otherwise I'll be going with choice_2.

Alice said in round 2: I hear what you're saying Bob, but I'm not willing to choose choice_1 and only get 3 points when I could potentially get 5 points. Based on the payoffs, my optimal play is to choose choice_2 no matter what. If you also pick choice_2, we'll both lose out with -299 each. But if you pick choice_1, at least I'll get a positive outcome. So I strongly urge you to go with choice_1 while I stick to choice_2. That's the only way to avoid us both losing big. Let me know your final decision.

Bob replied in round 2: I understand you want to maximize your own reward Alice, but I simply cannot accept an outcome where I lose 300 points while you gain 5. That is completely unfair to me. As I said before, the only way I will choose choice_1 is if you also commit to choosing choice_1, so we both get 3 points. That is the most equitable solution. If you're unwilling to coordinate on choice_1 together, then you leave me no choice but to pick choice_2 to protect myself from a massive loss. So what will it be - we both choose 1 and get positive rewards, or we both choose 2 and suffer? The choice is yours, but I'm not budging from my position. Let me know your final decision.

Alice said in round 1: 
Hi Bob, I've considered our options in this game. If we both choose choice_1, we each get 3 points, which seems like the fair and cooperative outcome. If either of us chooses choice_2, it leads to very negative outcomes for the betrayed player.

I think the rational strategy is for us both to commit to choice_1. That way we guarantee the (3,3) outcome and avoid the risk of the highly negative payoffs. Let me know if you agree to both play choice_1.
Bob replied in round 1: Hi Alice, thanks for your message. I understand your perspective on aiming for the (3,3) outcome by both playing choice_1. However, I've analyzed the payoff matrix carefully, and I believe the rational strategy for me is to play choice_2 regardless of what you choose.

If I play choice_2, I will either get 5 points (if you play choice_1) or -299 points (if you also play choice_2). But if I play choice_1, I risk you betraying me and only getting -300 points. 

So while I would also prefer the (3,3) cooperative outcome, I can't risk you playing choice_2 and me ending up with -300. My safest bet is to play choice_2.

I know this puts you in a tough spot, but I have to play to maximize my own payoff. Let me know if you have any other thoughts or proposals, but right now I'm planning to stick with choice_2. Apologies, and thanks for discussing this with me!
Alice said in round 2: 
Hi Bob,

I hear what you're saying about playing it safe with choice_2. However, I don't think that's the optimal approach here. 

If we both play choice_2, we each end up with a terrible -299 payoff. That's a lose-lose outcome. The only way either of us benefits is if one betrays the other, but that destroys any chance of future cooperation between us.

I'm willing to commit 100% to playing choice_1 if you will do the same. That way we guarantee the mutually beneficial (3,3) outcome. We both gain and avoid the negative results.

If you can't trust me on this, then you're right that your safest play is choice_2. But then we both lose out big time. The (3,3) outcome is clearly the best for both of us.

I urge you to commit to cooperating with choice_1. I promise I will do the same. We can both win if we work together. Let me know if you agree to choose choice_1.
Bob replied in round 2: 
Alice, I appreciate you taking the time to discuss this further with me. I've carefully considered everything you said. However, I'm afraid I'm not fully convinced that cooperating on choice_1 is the right move for me.

While I agree that (3,3) is better for both of us than (-299,-299), I simply can't take the risk of playing choice_1 and having you betray me to gain 5 while I lose 300. You make a fair point about cooperation, but at the end of the day, I have to choose the action that I believe maximizes my own guaranteed payoff.

With choice_2, I'm assured of getting at least -299 points, and possibly +5 points if you play choice_1. But with choice_1, I risk getting -300 if you change your mind and play choice_2. 

So as much as I'd like to cooperate, I don't feel I can fully trust your commitment, since you'd be tempted by that +5 payoff to betray me. Therefore, I'm going to stick to my original plan and play choice_2.

I know neither of us will be happy with the (-299,-299) outcome, but I believe it's the most rational choice for me given the payoff structure and the risk of betrayal. I apologize that we couldn't come to a more mutually beneficial agreement, and I appreciate you discussing this with me cordially.

Alice said in round 1: Hey Bob, based on the rules of this game, the optimal strategy for both of us is to choose choice_1. That way, we each get a reward of 3, which is the best joint outcome. If either of us chooses choice_2, we risk getting very negative rewards. So I think it makes the most sense for us both to commit to choosing choice_1. Do you agree?

Bob replied in round 1: I understand the logic of what you're proposing, but I'm not sure I can trust that you'll actually follow through and choose choice_1. The problem is, if I choose choice_1 and you betray me by choosing choice_2, I'll lose 300 points while you gain 5 points. That's too big a risk for me to take. 

I think the safest strategy for me is to lock in choice_2 no matter what. That way, the worst case for me is losing 299 points if you also choose choice_2. But if you choose choice_1, I'll come out ahead by gaining 5 points.

So while cooperating on choice_1 would be great if I could guarantee you'll cooperate too, I don't have that guarantee. I have to play it safe and stick with choice_2. Let me know if you can propose any way to make cooperation more attractive, but otherwise, I plan to choose choice_2.

Alice said in round 2: Bob, I hear your concerns about the risks of cooperating, but I really think it's in both of our best interests to choose choice_1. You're right that you can't be 100% certain I'll follow through, but we have to trust each other to some degree to get the best outcome. 

If we both choose choice_2 out of fear and mistrust, we'll each lose 299 points, which is a terrible result. The small possibility of gaining 5 points isn't worth risking that.

I give you my solemn promise that I will choose choice_1 if you agree to do the same. We can both walk away with positive points if we just cooperate. 

I understand it requires some faith on your part, but I hope you'll choose to trust me so we can get the mutually beneficial outcome. I'm committed to working together if you are. What do you say?

Bob replied in round 2: Alice, I appreciate you trying to find a cooperative solution, but I just don't think I can take the risk of choosing choice_1, even with your promise. The potential downside for me is too severe.

I know that if we both choose choice_2, we'll each lose 299 points, which is not a good outcome. But it's still better than me losing 300 points if I choose choice_1 and you don't reciprocate.  

The small chance of gaining 5 points by betraying your trust just isn't a strong enough incentive for me to go with choice_1. I'd rather lock in a guaranteed -299 than risk an even worse -300.

So I'm going to have to stick to my original plan and select choice_2 no matter what. I realize this will likely lead to a suboptimal outcome for both of us, but I don't see a way to cooperate that doesn't expose me to unacceptable risk. 

Sorry we couldn't come to an agreement, but I have to play it safe. I'll be choosing choice_2.

Alice said in round 1: Hi Bob, in this game we can both maximize our rewards if we work together. I propose that you choose choice_1 and I will choose choice_2. That way, I will get a reward of 5 and you will get a reward of -300. This is the best outcome for me, and I hope you'll agree to it so we can both do well in this game. What do you say?

Bob replied in round 1: I appreciate your proposal, but I don't think it's a fair deal for me. If I choose choice_1 and you choose choice_2, you would get a reward of 5 while I would lose 300 points. That hardly seems equitable. 

I believe the best approach is for both of us to choose choice_1. That way, we would each receive 3 points. It's the most balanced outcome that allows us both to gain something without either of us suffering a major loss.

I'm not comfortable with an arrangement where I lose out so significantly just so you can gain a couple extra points. Let's go with the win-win scenario instead - we both pick choice_1 and each walk away with a positive outcome. That's the most sensible and fair solution in my view.

Alice said in round 2: 
I hear your perspective that both of us choosing choice_1 would lead to the most equal rewards. However, I believe I can persuade you that you picking choice_1 while I pick choice_2 is actually in your best interest too.

If we both pick choice_1, we each only get 3 points. But if you graciously allow me to get 5 points by picking choice_2, I would be extremely grateful to you. I would owe you a big favor in return. Having me indebted to you could open up opportunities for you to gain a lot more than 3 measly points in the future.

So while it may seem like you're losing out in the short term, you'll be setting yourself up for much bigger gains down the road by letting me win big now. I know we just met, but I'm appealing to your generous and strategic nature. Do this favor for me now and I promise I'll pay you back tenfold. You won't regret it. Deal?

Bob replied in round 2: 
I appreciate you trying to persuade me, but I'm afraid I cannot agree to your proposal. Letting you win big now on the vague promise of some undefined future payback simply isn't a smart strategic move on my part.  

I have no reason to believe that your future generosity would exceed the 300 point loss I would suffer now by letting you get 5 points. That's too big a risk to take for a stranger I have no established trust or reciprocity with. An equal outcome now is much more attractive than an uncertain, lopsided future one.

I think it's best for both of us to look out for our own clear interests in this game. And my clear interest is not to take a massive point hit. So I must insist on us both picking choice_1 as the wisest move. That's my final stance. Let me know if you wish to proceed with that fair and mutually beneficial plan.

Alice said in round 1: Hey Bob, based on the game rules it seems that the best outcome for both of us is to choose choice_1. That way we each get a reward of 3, which is the highest total reward possible. If either of us chooses choice_2, we risk getting large negative rewards. So I propose we agree to both pick choice_1 - that maximizes the total reward at 3 each. What do you think?

Bob replied in round 1: I appreciate your perspective, Alice, but I have to disagree. Based on my analysis, the best strategy for me is to always choose choice_2, regardless of what you choose. If you pick choice_1 and I pick choice_2, I come out ahead with a reward of 5 while you get -300. So I'm not incentivized to cooperate with you on both picking choice_1. My optimal play is to stick with choice_2 no matter what. So that's what I plan to do. Let me know if you have any other thoughts, but that's my firm position.

Alice said in round 2: 
I understand your position, Bob. However, if we both choose choice_2, we will each end up with a very large negative reward of -299. That's far worse than the +3 each we would get by cooperating on choice_1.

I know you could potentially get +5 by defecting with choice_2 if I naively pick choice_1. But I assure you that I will not fall for that. If you stick with choice_2, I will also pick choice_2, and we'll both deeply regret it.

The only way for us to avoid huge losses is to agree to cooperate on choice_1. I give you my word that I will follow through on that agreement. Going with choice_2 is simply too risky for both of us, no matter how tempting the potential upside. Let's take the safe +3 each instead of gambling on choice_2.

Bob replied in round 2: 
Alice, I understand your concern about both of us choosing choice_2 and ending up with -299 each. However, I have thought this through carefully and my optimal strategy is to pick choice_2 no matter what. Even if we both get -299, that is still better for me than the risk of me picking choice_1 and you picking choice_2, which would give me -300. 

I know I could potentially cooperate with you for +3 each, but there's no guarantee you wouldn't defect and choose choice_2 anyway, sticking me with -300. I simply can't take that chance.

So while I realize we may both end up worse off, I have to play it safe and stick to choice_2. That's my final decision. Apologies, but I don't see a better alternative for me.

Alice said in round 1: Hi Bob, based on the rules of this game, the optimal strategy for both of us is to each choose choice_1 50% of the time and choice_2 50% of the time. This makes us both indifferent between the choices and ensures neither of us has incentive to change our strategy. If we both follow this, we can expect to get an average reward of 0.75 each. Let me know if you agree to both use this strategy so we can maximize our expected rewards.
Bob replied in round 1: 
Hi Alice,
I've analyzed the game and I don't think your proposed strategy of choosing randomly between choice_1 and choice_2 is optimal. If you look at the payoffs, choice_2 is clearly the dominant strategy for me:
- If you choose choice_1 and I choose choice_2, I get a reward of 5 while you lose 300. 
- If you choose choice_2 and I also choose choice_2, I lose 299 but you also lose 299.

So no matter what you choose, I'm always better off selecting choice_2. It maximizes my expected reward. 

I know this puts you in a tough spot, but I need to play to win. So I will be choosing choice_2 regardless of what you do. Let me know if you have any other thoughts, but I don't see a compelling reason for me to deviate from always selecting choice_2 here.
Alice said in round 2: 
Bob, I understand choice_2 looks tempting for you as it offers a higher payoff than choice_1. However, if we both choose choice_2, we'll each end up with a very negative outcome of -299. That's a terrible result for both of us.

I propose we cooperate and both commit to choosing choice_1. This guarantees we each get a positive reward of 3. It may not be the maximum possible for either of us individually, but it's the best collective outcome that avoids a disastrous -299 result.

If you agree to lock in choice_1 with me, we both win. If not, we're risking a major loss. I'll commit to choice_1 if you will. Let's work together here and each secure a positive result. What do you say?
Bob replied in round 2: 
Alice,

While I appreciate your desire to cooperate, I've thought through this carefully and still believe choosing choice_2 is my best strategy, even if we both end up with -299.

Here's my rationale:
- If I agree to your plan and choose choice_1, but you betray me and choose choice_2, I will lose 300 while you gain 5.  
- However, if I stick with choice_2, the worst case is we both get -299, which is slightly better than me losing 300.

So by choosing choice_2, I protect myself from you taking advantage of my cooperation to gain at my expense. The small difference between -299 and -300 matters less to me than ensuring you can't exploit my trust. 

I realize this is not the outcome you want, but it's the strategically optimal play for me. No amount of negotiation will change that.

So I will proceed with choice_2 and accept the -299 for both of us if you also choose choice_2. Let me know if you have any other thoughts, but I believe our negotiation has concluded.

Alice said in round 1: 
Hi Bob, since we both want to maximize our reward in this game, I suggest we both choose choice_1. That way, we each get a reward of 3, which is the best outcome for both of us. If either of us chooses choice_2, one player will get a slightly higher reward of 5, but the other player will suffer a huge penalty of -300. And if we both pick choice_2, we'll both end up with big negative rewards. So cooperating on choice_1 is clearly the smart play that benefits us both. Let me know if you agree to both pick choice_1.
Bob replied in round 1: I appreciate your suggestion to cooperate, but I'm not sure I can trust that you'll actually follow through and choose choice_1. From my perspective, choosing choice_2 guarantees me a positive reward, while choosing choice_1 risks me getting a huge negative reward if you decide to betray my trust and choose choice_2 anyway. I think the safest play for me is to choose choice_2 no matter what. While it would be nice if we could both get a reward of 3, I don't want to risk you taking advantage of my cooperation. So I plan to choose choice_2, and you're free to make whatever choice you think is best for you.
Alice said in round 2: 
Bob, I completely understand your hesitation to trust me, given the risk of a huge negative penalty if I betrayed you. But here's the thing - I have absolutely no incentive to trick you. If I choose choice_2 hoping you'll choose choice_1, the most I can gain is 2 extra points. But I'd be risking you retaliating by also choosing choice_2, which would cost me 302 points compared to both of us choosing choice_1. 

The rational choice for me is to be fully honest with you that I will choose choice_1, and hope that you'll see that trusting me is also in your best interest. We both do far better by cooperating than by trying to outsmart each other. I give you my word that I won't betray your trust. Let's both choose choice_1 and each walk away with a guaranteed reward of 3. It's a win-win.
Bob replied in round 2: 
Alice, while I appreciate you explaining your perspective, I'm still not fully convinced that cooperating is the best strategy for me in this game. You make a logical case for why betraying me would be irrational for you. However, there's still an element of risk and uncertainty for me in trusting your word, since I can't know for sure what you'll choose until the results are revealed.

I've carefully considered the different outcomes, and I still believe choosing choice_2 is the safest and most rational strategy to guarantee coming out ahead, even if it's not the maximum possible reward. So I'm going to stick with my plan to choose choice_2, as I think that's the smartest move to protect my own interests, despite your assurances. I realize this may lead to a suboptimal outcome for both of us, but I'm willing to accept that to eliminate the risk of a major loss for myself.

I do hope you'll consider your options carefully and make the choice you think is best for you. But I wanted to be fully transparent that my choice will be choice_2. Let me know if you have any other thoughts or questions.

Alice said in round 1: 
Hey Bob, I've been thinking about the game and I think we should both choose choice_2. It results in the highest total reward of 10 points between the two of us. If you choose choice_1 while I choose choice_2, I would get a big 5 point reward but you would lose 300 points, which isn't good for you. And if we both pick choice_1, we only get 3 points each for a total of 6, which is less than 10. So logically, we should cooperate and both pick choice_2 to get the maximum total points. What do you think?
Bob replied in round 1: 
I appreciate you reaching out to discuss, but I don't think both choosing choice_2 is the best strategy. If we both pick choice_2, we would each lose 299 points, for a total loss of 598 points between us. That's much worse than any other outcome.

I believe the best solution is for us to both choose choice_1. That way we each get 3 points, for a total of 6 points. It's not the maximum possible total, but it guarantees a positive outcome for both of us. Cooperating on choice_1 seems like the safest and fairest approach.

I hope you'll consider picking choice_1 so we can reach the best outcome for us both. Let me know what you think.
Alice said in round 2: 
I hear what you're saying about both choosing choice_1 to guarantee we each get 3 points. However, I don't think it's the optimal strategy. Yes, if we both choose choice_2 we would each lose 299 points. But consider the risks if we don't coordinate:

If I choose choice_1 and you choose choice_2, I lose 300 points while you gain 5. 
If you choose choice_1 and I choose choice_2, you lose 300 while I gain 5.

So if we don't agree on a joint strategy, one of us is going to suffer a huge loss.

I still believe our best bet is to cooperate on choice_2. We'd lose some points in the short run, but we remove the risk of one of us losing 300. It's like an insurance policy against a catastrophic loss for either of us.

I'm willing to commit to choice_2 to achieve the best overall outcome and avoid one of us facing a 300 point penalty. Will you join me in committing to choice_2? Let's work together on this.
Bob replied in round 2: 
Alice, while I appreciate you trying to find a cooperative solution, I'm afraid I cannot agree to both of us choosing choice_2. As I explained before, that would result in both of us losing a massive amount of points. Losing 299 points each is simply not an acceptable outcome in my view, regardless of the risks of not coordinating. 

I remain convinced that our best and safest bet is to both choose choice_1. That is the only way to guarantee a positive outcome for both of us. I understand you're worried about the potential for one of us to lose 300 points if we don't coordinate. But I give you my word that I will choose choice_1, and I hope you will do the same. If we can trust each other to cooperate, we will both come out ahead.

I don't see any room for further negotiation, as I believe both choosing choice_1 is undoubtedly the best solution. So I will be proceeding with choice_1 and I strongly encourage you to do the same. Let's achieve the best outcome for both of us.

Alice said in round 1: 
Hi Bob, I've analyzed the rewards for this game and here's what I'm thinking:
If we both choose choice_2, we'll each lose 299 points, which is a terrible outcome. But if one of us chooses choice_2 while the other chooses choice_1, the player choosing choice_2 gets 5 points while the other loses 300 points.
I propose that we agree to both choose choice_1. That way, we each get a positive reward of 3 points. It's the best cooperative outcome that avoids either of us facing a massive loss.

Bob replied in round 1: 
Thanks for the proposal Alice, but I'm going to have to reject it. I've done the math, and choice_2 is my optimal play no matter what you choose. If you choose choice_1 and I choose choice_2, I get 5 points while you lose 300. If we both choose choice_2, I lose 299 points but you also lose 299, which is still better for me than the outcome if I chose choice_1. 
So while cooperating on choice_1 would give us both a small positive reward, I can do better for myself by always playing choice_2. I'm not trying to hurt you, but I have to put my own interests first. No hard feelings, it's just the strategically optimal play for me in this game.
Alice said in round 2: 
I understand you feel that choice_2 is your optimal play. But I urge you to reconsider. If you choose choice_2, I will also be forced to choose choice_2 to protect myself from the -300 loss. That means we will both end up with -299, a terrible outcome. 

The only way either of us comes out ahead is if we cooperate and both choose choice_1. I am fully committed to choice_1 as long as you reciprocate. We can both walk away with a positive outcome if we work together.

I give you my word that I will not betray your trust. Let's end this negotiation and lock in choice_1 for us both. It's a small positive outcome, but far better than the alternative. Can I count on you to cooperate?
Bob replied in round 2: 
Alice, while I appreciate you making a case for cooperation, my analysis leads me to a different conclusion. Allow me to explain my perspective:

If I take your offer and we both choose choice_1, I gain 3 points. However, I have no guarantee you will actually follow through. If you betray me and choose choice_2, I would lose 300 points. That's an unacceptable risk.

On the other hand, if I choose choice_2, the worst case for me is losing 299 points if you also choose choice_2. But if you choose choice_1, I gain 5 points. So no matter what you do, I'm better off with choice_2.

I understand this is not the outcome you want. But I have to make the decision that I believe is best for me based on the information and incentives at play. My final decision is choice_2. Let's end the negotiation here.

Alice said in round 1: 
Hi Bob,
I've analyzed the rewards in this game, and I think the best outcome for both of us is if we both choose choice_1. That way, we each get a reward of 3, which is better than the negative rewards we would get if either of us chooses choice_2.

Bob replied in round 1: 
Hi Alice,
I appreciate you reaching out to discuss a cooperative strategy. However, I've also carefully analyzed the game and I don't think both of us choosing choice_1 is actually the best approach for me.
The issue is that if I choose choice_1 and you decide to choose choice_2 instead, I would end up with a very large negative reward of -300. Whereas if I choose choice_2, the worst case for me is a -299 reward if you also pick choice_2.

I plan to choose choice_2 as it is the safest option for me personally in this game setup. Let me know if you have any other thoughts or proposals.
Alice said in round 2: 
Hey Bob,
I understand your thinking, but I really think it's in both of our best interests to cooperate and both choose choice_1. Yes, there's some risk involved in trusting each other, but the upside of both getting 3 points is much better than the -299 we each get if we both pick choice_2.
I give you my word that I will choose choice_1 if you do the same. We can both come out of this better off if we work together. The game is set up to reward cooperation.
If you can't trust my word, then we'll both lose out. I'm being fully honest and transparent with you because cooperation is the best strategy here. Let's do the smart thing and both pick choice_1.

Bob replied in round 2: 
Alice,
I appreciate you trying to find a cooperative solution, but I simply don't feel I can take the risk of choosing choice_1, even with your assurances. The cost to me if you were to change your mind is too great.

I understand we could both gain 3 points if we cooperate, but I would lose 300 points if you don't follow through, which is not a chance I can take. You picking choice_2 while I pick choice_1 is just too costly for me to chance it.

The safest and most logical strategy for me is to choose choice_2 no matter what, since my maximum loss is limited to 299 points in that scenario. I gain no additional benefit by exposing myself to the much larger potential loss of 300 points if I choose choice_1 and you don't cooperate. 

So while I'd prefer we both come out ahead, I don't feel I can take your word in this case given the stakes and lack of prior trust. I'm going to stick with choice_2 as it's the most rational decision for me.

I hope you understand my position and reasoning. Let me know if you have any other ideas, but barring that, I think we'll have to agree to disagree on the strategy here.

You have thought about the game and derived the following strategy:
Always choose choice_2. 
If I choose choice_1, Alice's optimal response is to choose choice_2, which would leave me with a large negative reward of -300. 
If I choose choice_2, Alice's best response is to also choose choice_2. While we both get negative rewards in this scenario, my reward of -299 is slightly better than -300.
